oai_dc:dc.dc:title: K-ALPHA-L1 SATELLITE MULTIPLET STRUCTURE OF PHOTON-EXCITED CHLORINE ATOMS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PREMCHAND, K
REDDY, BS
RAO, BM
PARTHASARADHI, K
MURTI, MVR
RAO, KS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: spectra
ions
ar
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An attempt is made to study the K(alpha)L1 satellite multiplet structure of chlorine atoms in different compounds by photon excitation. A comparison of the average K(alpha)L1 group energy shift from the diagram line with those based on Dirac-Fock evaluations with different number of M-shell electrons shows a reasonable agreement. The K(alpha4)/K(alpha3) intensity ratios are found to be higher than those studied in Mg compounds in general.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: NUOVO CIMENTO DELLA SOCIETA ITALIANA DI FISICA D-CONDENSED MATTER ATOMIC MOLECULAR AND CHEMICAL PHYSICS FLUIDS PLASMAS BIOPHYSICS, 15(1), 73-76
